title: Poland to Launch Key Suborbital Rocket Test Flight from Norway
summary: Poland’s Łukasiewicz Institute of Aviation has announced that it will launch its ILR-33 Amber 2K rocket from Norway this month on its first mission to space. When development of the ILR-33 Amber 2K rocket began, the institute set a goal of developing a rocket that could carry a ten-kilogram payload to an altitude of 100 […]

title: Turion wins Space Force contract for debris-capture technology
summary: The startup Turion Space is developing a family of satellites for autonomous docking and deorbiting services

title: Transferring the International Space Station into the future
summary: When it's time to retire the International Space Station, it should be moved to higher orbit, so that it may one day be made useful again, rather than incinerated.

title: Chinese space firm unintentionally launches its new rocket
summary: Space Pioneer had been prepping the vehicle for its debut launch later this summer.

title: SpaceX to launch Yahsat satellites
summary: Emirati satellite operator Yahsat has selected SpaceX to launch a pair of geostationary communications satellites that are part of a $1.1 billion program.

title: Happy launch anniversary, Euclid!
summary: Several team members wish Euclid a happy first launch anniversary in their own language. ESA’s Euclid satellite launched on 1 July 2023 on a SpaceX Falcon 9, and now resides in an orbit around the Sun-Earth Lagrange point L2. During its mission, Euclid will observe billions of galaxies out to ten billion light-years over one third of the sky to study dark matter and dark energy.

title: H3 launches ALOS-4 advanced Earth observation satellite
summary: Japan’s H3 rocket successfully launched an Earth observation satellite Sunday on its third flight.

title: NASA and SpaceX studying ways to mitigate Dragon trunk debris
summary: NASA and SpaceX are examining how to alter the Dragon spacecraft’s reentry process to limit the amount of debris from the spacecraft’s trunk section that reaches the ground.

title: Amazon's Project Kuiper Broadband Services Delayed to 2025
summary: Amazon's Project Kuiper Broadband Services Delayed to 2025
